Specific Details: ??Northside Partnership CEO and NSP Director of Services met with Deputy Cian O'Callaghan to brief him on the Department of Social Protection decision to utilise a competitive process to procure a Local Employment type services model as part of the Department's Contracted Employment Services offerings.  NSP wished to inform the Deputy on potential negative implications of the procurement process for the community and voluntary sector and on Northside Partnership in particular should it not be su
Subject Matter: ??Northside Partnership CEO and NSP Director of Services met with Deputy Cian O'Callaghan to brief him on the Department of Social Protection decision to utilise a competitive process to procure a Local Employment type services model as part of the Department's Contracted Employment Services offerings.  NSP wished to inform the Deputy on potential negative implications of the procurement process for the community and voluntary sector and on Northside Partnership in particular should it not be su
Intended Results: We are asking Deputy O’Callaghan and other deputies to question the need for public procurement and consider the wider implications of this approach to the delivery of social and community services across Ireland. We ask that this be considered in the context of developing a stakeholder led economy and not share holder led economy.  We would ask that the Deputy question Government policy which seems to support the opening and developing market space for for-profit private sector organisations in
Lobbying Activities: ??A meeting was held with Deputy Cian O'Callaghan on Wednesday the 21st of April via Microsoft Teams at which the matter was discussed.|Meeting|1
